demographics.name: Sarah Chen
demographics.supportServices: Nutrition Consult (Pre-Tx), Speech Path Consult (Pre-Tx), PEG Tube placed

diagnosis.primary: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCCa) of the Left Tonsil
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Persistent sore throat, feeling of lump in throat, palpable left neck node.
diagnosis.relevantHistory: Former smoker (quit 15 yrs ago), social EtOH.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Chemotherapy
treatmentPlan.rtRxDetails: 70 Gy / 35 fx (SIB to PTV_High), PTV_Int: 63Gy, PTV_Low: 56Gy
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV_High (GTV L Tonsil + L N1 node + margin), PTV_Intermediate (High-Risk Nodal Regions), PTV_Low (Elective Nodal Regions)
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 IV every 3 weeks (Cycles on Day 1, 22, 43) - Managed by Dr. Lisa Green
medications: Pain Medication (e.g., Oxycodone PRN severe throat pain)
PEG tube placed pre-treatment for nutritional support
therapistAlerts: Assess for mucositis and skin reaction daily.
Verify PEG tube site is clean and dry.
High risk for dehydration; encourage fluid intake.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in custom thermoplastic mask extending to shoulders, appropriate headrest, shoulders retracted down. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point mask marks aligned to room lasers. Isocenter at L0.0, L+1.0, V-3.0 from CT sim reference point.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired for H&N IMRT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET/CT. Dental eval completed prior. Patient tolerated well. Mask fit confirmed.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. James Miller
dosimetry.constraints: Spinal Cord Max < 45 Gy; Brainstem Max < 54 Gy; Parotid Mean < 26 Gy. All constraints met.
dosimetry.planNotes: Complex H&N IMRT with SIB. Patient to receive weekly chemotherapy.

igrtProtocol.alignment: Bony anatomy of C-Spine, then soft tissue check.

fractions.setupNotes: CBCT daily, good match. Mask fit well.
fractions.sideEffects: Pre-medicated for chemo. No acute RT side effects.
fractions.notes: Cycle 1 Cisplatin given today prior to RT.

fractions.setupNotes: CBCT daily. Shifts V:0, L:-0.2, L:0.1. Approved.
fractions.sideEffects: Moderate throat pain (Grade 2 mucositis). Using Magic Mouthwash. Skin Grade 1 erythema.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerating PEG feeds. OTV scheduled after treatment.

reportDetails.diagnosis: SQUAMOUS CELL CARCINOMA, INVASIVE, HPV-RELATED (p16 POSITIVE).
reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Sections show fragments of squamous mucosa with underlying infiltration by nests and islands of atypical squamous cells with keratinization. Mitotic figures are present. Immunohistochemical stain for p16 shows strong, diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic positivity in the tumor cells.
reportDetails.comment: The histologic features and p16 positivity are consistent with HPV-related invasive squamous cell carcinoma.
